item.title: Who is Gus Walz? The 17-year-old son of Tim Walz with learning disorder who stole the spotlight at DNC
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Queen Elizabeth really find Trump 'very rude'? The answer might surprise you
item.description: A former Buckingham Palace aide dismissed claims from an upcoming biography that Queen Elizabeth II found Donald Trump rude during his visits. The aide stated that the Queen had described Trump and his family as gracious and wonderful guests. The controversy arises from differing accounts about Trump's behavior and the Queen's impressions during state visits.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian doctor held in US over nude pictures and clips of kids, women
Australia’s beloved gay penguin Sphen, known for raising chicks with same-sex partner, dies at 12
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taylor Swift's first reaction on Vienna tour cancellation due to terror attack threat: 'We were grieving ...'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Oprah slams Vance's ‘Childless cat lady’ jab in DNC speech: ‘Decency and respect on the Ballot in 2024’
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘That’s my dad!’: Tim Walz’s son Gus bursts into tears during father's emotional DNC speech
item.description: At the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Governor Tim Walz’s emotional speech on Thursday resonated with the audience, particularly his family. He accepted the vice presidential nomination, sharing personal struggles with infertility. His son Gus, 17, was moved to tears, highlighting the familial bond and the impact of Walz’s journey with fertility treatments.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Oprah Winfrey urges Americans to 'choose common sense over nonsense' in DNC speech, taking subtle jabs at Trump and Vance: Key points
item.description: Oprah Winfrey called for unity at the Democratic National Convention, subtly critiquing Donald Trump and JD Vance. She urged support for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, emphasizing loyalty to the Constitution and common sense. Winfrey shared her personal reasons for speaking out, highlighting America's role in her success.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Pandit Rakesh Bhatt? Hindu priest who opened DNC Day 3 with vedic prayer
item.description: Pandit Rakesh Bhatt, a Hindu priest from Bengaluru, brought a spiritual touch to the Democratic National Convention in Chicago. He led a traditional Hindu prayer, emphasizing unity and justice through the Sanskrit concept of 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam.' Bhatt's involvement underscored themes of world peace and harmony, inspiring a sense of unity among the diverse attendees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bill Clinton jokes about Kamala Harris' McDonald's past during DNC speech: 'She’ll break my record'
item.description: Former President Bill Clinton humorously highlighted Vice President Kamala Harris' early job at McDonald's during his speech at the Democratic National Convention. Clinton wanted to show Harris' dedication to public service, from her student years to her current role. He joked about his own fondness for McDonald's, famously commemorated at a Little Rock location.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Million miles an hour': Astronomy student discovers mysterious high-speed object racing through space
item.description: A UK astronomy student, Tom Bickle, discovered a hypervelocity object hurtling through space at one million miles per hour. Classified as either a low-mass star or brown dwarf, this object may escape the Milky Way's gravitational pull. An unusual origin is suggested, possibly from a supernova or ejection from a star cluster.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh to sign international convention on enforced disappearances: Govt
Sphen the penguin, one half of renowned gay pair, dies
item.description: Sphen, a beloved gentoo penguin at Sea Life Sydney Aquarium, passed away at 11, leaving his partner, Magic, and their foster chicks. Their same-sex relationship gained international attention, symbolizing inclusivity. Magic was given time with Sphen's body to mourn. The couple inspired global audiences and even featured in Sydney’s Mardi Gras parade and educational curriculum.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jujitsu and motorbikes: Ukrainian spirit remains strong despite the war
item.description: Artyom Kuzmich, who lost his leg in the Ukraine conflict, went viral for aiding victims at Okhmatdyt children's hospital after it was hit by a missile. A former special forces member, he excels in Brazilian jujitsu and runs a para-jujitsu school in Kyiv. He hopes to expand his motorbike club while anticipating his child's birth.
item.dc:creator: Rudroneel Ghosh

item.title: Trump suddenly stops North Carolina rally mid-speech and asks for 'a doctor, please!'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I am still younger than him': Bill Clinton jokes about Trump's age at DNC
item.description: Bill Clinton and Tim Walz endorsed Kamala Harris at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago. Clinton, turning 78, humorously noted he is younger than Donald Trump but did not mention the 81-year-old President Joe Biden. Clinton highlighted Harris's vision and experience, emphasizing her ability to lead and address the nation's challenges.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Musk evicts Willy Wonka actor's nephew from $13 million childhood home
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden to Netanyahu over Gaza conflict: 'Urgency of bringing ceasefire and hostage release deal to closure'
item.description: President Biden discussed with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu about a cease-fire in Gaza, highlighting its urgency. They aimed to address obstacles in upcoming Cairo talks involving the US, Israel, Egypt, and Qatar. Biden remains committed to a cease-fire despite Hamas backing off, while challenges remain around Israeli troop presence in key Gaza corridors.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Should I get personal?': Trump fires back at Obamas for DNC attacks, says former president 'was very nasty’
item.description: Former President Donald Trump responded to criticisms from Barack and Michelle Obama during the Democratic National Convention. Trump, at a rally in Asheboro, North Carolina, accused the Obamas of personal attacks and asked supporters if he should respond in kind. Despite advice to focus on policy, Trump questioned whether to stick to this approach.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘American Airlines didn’t care’: Albany exec Dan McCoy misses DNC flight over chicken sandwich, tries to use status to board
item.description: Albany County Executive Dan McCoy tried to use his political influence to board an American Airlines flight after missing his boarding call while getting Chick-fil-A. Despite mentioning his title, the airline staff did not reopen the doors. McCoy and a staffer later booked a different flight. No public funds were used for the trip, said McCoy’s spokesperson.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
